titleStmt.title: Bartlett, at the Golden Ball, by the tavern in Prescot-street in Goodmans-fields, London. His inventions of steel trusses and instruments, medicines and methods to cure ruptures, faults of the testicles, and falling out of the fundament or womb, and make the weak strong and the crooked strait. ...
titleStmt.author: Bartlett, C.

notesStmt.note: Title taken from caption and first lines of text.
At end: "By C. Bartlett, at the Golden Ball, next door to the ship tavern in Prescot-street in Goodmans-fields, London, ..."
